tit.cmt: 英語表記に変更他の祭りのファイルとの整合性

sen.j: 冬祭り（ふゆまつり）とは、冬に行われる祭りのこと。
sen.e: Fuyumatsuri is the festival celebrated during the winter.
Winter festivals are the festivals celebrated during the winter
Winter festivals are the festivals celebrated during the winter

sen.j: 立冬から立春にかけての3ヶ月間（11月・12月・1月）に行われるものを指す場合が多い。
sen.e: Fuyumatsuri often indicates the festivals celebrated during the three months from ritto (the first day of winter on Japanese calendar) through risshun (the first day of spring on Japanese calendar).

Winter festivals often indicate the festivals celebrated during the three months (November, December and January) from ritto (the first day of winter in the Japanese calendar) through risshun (the first day of spring in the Japanese calendar).
sen.cmt: 英語表記に変更「（11月・12月・1月）」の記述を追加
sen.e: Winter festivals often indicate the festivals celebrated during the three months (November, December and January) from ritto (the first day of winter in the Japanese calendar) through risshun (the first day of spring in the Japanese calendar).

sen.j: 冬祭りは秋祭りが持つ収穫祭的要素と春祭りが持つ祈年祭的要素の両方を併せ持っている。
sen.e: Fuyumatsuri have both the elements of harvest festival that akimaturi (autumn festival) has and the elements of kinensai (prayer service for a good crop) that harumatsuri (spring festival) has.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Winter festivals have both the elements of the harvest festival that autumn festivals have and the elements of the Kinen-sai festival (prayer service for a good crop) that spring festivals have.
sen.cmt: 英語表記に変更spring festivalの前のスペースを削除
sen.e: Winter festivals have both the elements of the harvest festival that autumn festivals have and the elements of the Kinen-sai festival (prayer service for a good crop) that spring festivals have.

sen.j: その位置づけについては不明な部分も多い。
sen.e: And many aspects of its position in the annual festivals are unclear.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the position of the winter festivals in the annual festivals are unclear.
However, the position of the winter festivals in the annual festivals are unclear.

sen.j: 元々10月 (旧暦)は忌月とされたために月が変わって冬に突入した11月 (旧暦)に収穫祭を行った。
sen.e: Originally, as October (on lunar-solar calendar) was supposed to be a taboo month, the harvest festival was celebrated in November (on lunar-solar calendar) when the season changes from autumn to winter on Japanese calendar.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, as October (in the old lunar calendar) was supposed to be a taboo month, the harvest festival was celebrated in November (in the old lunar calendar) when the season changes from autumn to winter in the Japanese calendar.

Originally, as October (in the old lunar calendar) was supposed to be a taboo month, the harvest festival was celebrated in November (in the old lunar calendar) when the season changes from autumn to winter in the Japanese calendar.

sen.j: 後にその禁忌が失われて収穫直後に秋祭りが成立したとも言われている。
sen.e: And it is said that later the taboo lost its meaning and autumn festival came to be celebrated just after autumn festival.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And it is said that later the taboo lost its meaning and the autumn festivals came to be celebrated just after harvesting.
sen.cmt: just after autumn festival→just after harvestingに変更
sen.e: And it is said that later the taboo lost its meaning and the autumn festivals came to be celebrated just after harvesting.

sen.j: 折口信夫は秋から翌春にかけてのこの時期を魂振を行って人間を含めた全ての魂が更新されるための時期として捉えた。
sen.e: Shinobu ORIGUCHI perceived the period which is from autumn through the next spring as the period that all the souls including the ones of human beings are renewed by holding the ceremony of tamafuri (shaking of souls).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shinobu ORIGUCHI perceived the period which is from autumn through the next spring as the period that all souls including the ones of human beings are renewed by holding the ceremony of tamafuri (shaking of souls).

Shinobu ORIGUCHI perceived the period which is from autumn through the next spring as the period that all souls including the ones of human beings are renewed by holding the ceremony of tamafuri (shaking of souls).

sen.j: 秋祭り・冬祭り・春祭りは元々一続きの祭り（収穫・魂の更新・祈年）であったのが、秋祭りと春祭りが分離して残りが冬祭りとなったと説く。
sen.e: And he claimed that akimatsuri, fuyumaturi and harumatsuri were originally a series of festivals (harvest, renewal of souls and prayer for a good crop), and then akimatsuri and harumatsuri were separated, and the rest became fuyumatsuri.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And he claimed that autumn festivals, winter festivals and spring festivals were originally a series of festivals (harvest, renewal of souls and prayer for a good crop), and then autumn festivals and spring festivals were separated, and the rest became winter festivals.

And he claimed that autumn festivals, winter festivals and spring festivals were originally a series of festivals (harvest, renewal of souls and prayer for a good crop), and then autumn festivals and spring festivals were separated, and the rest became winter festivals.

sen.j: また、柳田国男は冬祭りの中心となる旧暦11月が冬至を含む時期であり春に向かう転機であることを指摘し、日本の祭りは本来旧暦11月を重要視したと説く。
sen.e: In addition, Kunio YANAGITA claimed that in Japanese festivals November on lunar-solar calendar was regarded as important because November on lunar-solar calendar when the most winter festivals were cerebrated includes winter solstice and it indicates the turning point going toward spring.

In addition, Kunio YANAGITA claimed that, in Japanese festivals, November in the old lunar calendar was regarded as important because November when the most winter festivals were cerebrated includes the winter solstice and it indicates the turning point going towards spring.
sen.cmt: 旧暦の表記を変更冠詞toward→towardsに変更
sen.e: In addition, Kunio YANAGITA claimed that, in Japanese festivals, November in the old lunar calendar was regarded as important because November when the most winter festivals were cerebrated includes the winter solstice and it indicates the turning point going towards spring.

sen.j: 朝廷の神祇官の四時祭では、旧暦11月の相嘗祭・鎮魂祭・新嘗祭が冬祭りとされた。
sen.e: In shijisai (festivals of four seasons) of jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony) in Imperial court, ainamesai festival (the festival offering newly-harvested grains to deities), tamashizume no matsuri (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul) and Niinamesai festival were defined as fuyumatsuri.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Shiji-sai festivals (festivals of four seasons) of jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony) in the Imperial Court, the festivals of Ainame (the festival offering newly-harvested grains to deities), Tamashizume (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul) and Niiname (festival of consumption of the new grains) in November in the old lunar calendar were defined as winter festivals.

In Shiji-sai festivals (festivals of four seasons) of jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony) in the Imperial Court, the festivals of Ainame (the festival offering newly-harvested grains to deities), Tamashizume (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul) and Niiname (festival of consumption of the new grains) in November in the old lunar calendar were defined as winter festivals.

sen.j: 翌月の月次・鎮火・道饗も冬特有の祭事ではないものの、冬祭りとして挙行されている。
sen.e: Though the festivals of tsukinami, chinka and michiae in December were not peculiar to winter, they were celebrated as fuyumatsuri.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Though the festivals of Tsukinami (festival of the months), Chinka (fire prevention festival) and Michiae (banquet of the road) in December were not peculiar to winter, they were celebrated as winter festivals.
sen.cmt: 祭りの説明を追加英語表記に変更
sen.e: Though the festivals of Tsukinami (festival of the months), Chinka (fire prevention festival) and Michiae (banquet of the road) in December were not peculiar to winter, they were celebrated as winter festivals.

sen.j: 現在、冬祭りとして行われるものは、鎮魂祭の要素を残すものが多い。
sen.e: Nowadays, the festivals celebrated as fuyumatsuri are the ones that still include the elements of tamashizume no matsuri festival (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nowadays, the festivals celebrated as winter festivals are the ones that still include the elements of the Tamashizume no matsuri festival (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul).
sen.cmt: 祭りの表記を変更英語表記に変更
sen.e: Nowadays, the festivals celebrated as winter festivals are the ones that still include the elements of the Tamashizume no matsuri festival (mass or ceremony for the repose of a soul).

sen.j: 鎮魂祭の際に行われた霜月神楽を祖とする湯立・神楽などが行われることが多い。
sen.e: And in the fuyumatsuri of the present day yudate or boiling water kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine) whose origin dates back to shimotsuki kagura (November kagura) performed at tamashizume no matsuri is often performed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And in the winter festivals of the present day, yudate or boiling water kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine) whose origin dates back to shimotsuki kagura (November kagura) is often performed at the Tamashizume no matsuri festival.
sen.cmt: 祭りの表記を微修正Novemberの前のスペースを削除文末の重複部分を削除英語表記に変更
sen.e: And in the winter festivals of the present day, yudate or boiling water kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine) whose origin dates back to shimotsuki kagura (November kagura) is often performed at the Tamashizume no matsuri festival.
